question_text: When 1 part of the rectangle is shaded, what fraction is represented?
solution: First, look at the rectangle and count how many equal parts it has.
The rectangle has 3 equal parts. When something is divided into 3 equal parts, each part is 1 of the 3, which we write as $\frac{1}{3}$.
If we shade 1 part of the rectangle, 1 out of 3 parts is shaded.
Therefore, when 1 part is shaded, the fraction $\frac{1}{3}$ is shaded.
solution_image_tag: A vertical rectangular bar divided into three equal sections. Only the top section is shaded in green, while the bottom two sections remain white/unshaded. This appears to represent the fraction 1/3 visually.
backend_description: Three empty rectangles stacked vertically on top of each other. Each rectangle has a green border with a white interior, and they appear to be of equal size.

solution_image_tag: A rectangle divided into 6 equal parts in a 1×6 grid. 2 parts are shaded pink with the fraction '2/6' written inside. The remaining parts are white/unshaded.
